column4: hey guys if I want to install a new nvidia card, is there a chance of messing up my system if I just plug it in and boot up?
usually just plugin and boot-up, dont forget to install the drivers after booting

ok.  just asking because I think my DVI port on my monitor is broken.  Ubuntu doesn't seem to detect my monitor using DVI but it can detect it when I  use RBG.  I bought a new 1GB 250OC video card hoping that might fix the problem
I already have an nvidia card installed with the 185 driver.  Should I do anything to it before I install the new video card?
you're swapping from nvndia to nvidia?
yeah.  I"m switching my 8800GTX for a GTS 250 OC
I would recomend you to remove the actual drivers (nvidia-180 I guess) then swapping and adding the new one (196 i guess)
not sure... thats why I said that
the most recent is 185 in the repos
yeah I've done it before.  But I'm wondering if that could be the cause of Ubuntu not recognizing my monitor in DVI mode
its possible, cant be sure till you tested
I need to find someone else with a DVI port on their computer to hook up to my monitor so that I can know for sure my monitor is not the one at fault.
ok I'm just going to shut off my computer, swap out the video cards and hope for th ebest
good look, tell us back the results
sweet everything seems to be working great, now I just have to try my connecti via a DVI cable and see if that might work =\
